description.narrative: 2.1. By 2021, pregnant women living with HIV have access to quality elimination of mother to child transmission of HIV (eMTCT) services and their infants have improved access to early diagnosis, treatment and care ( first decade), which contributes to Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By 2021, children, adolescents, and pregnant women use quality, accessible, and proven HIV prevention and treatment interventions.

sector.narrative: HIV and AIDS monitoring and bottleneck analysis
HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence
PMTCT program support such as retention in care, family planning, infant feeding, infant medical male circumcision and community facility linkages

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.1. By 2021, pregnant women living with HIV have access to quality elimination of mother to child transmission of HIV (eMTCT) services and their infants have improved access to early diagnosis, treatment and care ( first decade)

description.narrative: By mid-2020, all health facilities providing ANC were providing PMTCT services reaching 86% of pregnant women living with HIV with ART for preventing HIV transmission to infants and up to 73% of ART sites were offering paediatric ART leading to 79% of children 0-14 years living with HIV being on ART | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Health facilities that provide paediatric ART
Health facilities providing life long ART for pregnant and breast feeding women within the MNCH setting
